briefdescription.para: File extension for output files (e.g., ".pdf", ".png"). Default is ".pdf".
Base filename for output files. Default is "untitled".
Directory path for output files. Default is "./Figures".
Minimum value for x-axis. Default is 0.
Minimum value for y-axis. Default is 0.
Maximum value for x-axis. Default is 0 (auto-determined if not set).
Maximum value for y-axis. Default is 0 (auto-determined if not set).
Number of bins for x-axis. Default is 100.
Number of bins for y-axis. Default is 100.
Flag to enable/disable error bars. Default is false.
Flag to enable/disable counts display. Default is false.
Plot style. Default is "ROOT".
Plot title. Default is "untitled".
Y-axis title. Default is "y-axis".
X-axis title. Default is "x-axis".
Histogram fill style. Default is "fill".
Overflow handling. Default is "sum".
Marker style. Default is ".".
Hatch style. Default is empty.
Line style. Default is "-".
Default color for plots. Default is empty.
List of colors for multi-series plots.
Flag to enable/disable stacking. Default is false.
Flag to enable/disable density normalization. Default is false.
Flag to enable/disable logarithmic x-axis. Default is false.
Flag to enable/disable logarithmic y-axis. Default is false.
Line width for plots. Default is 0.1.
Cap size for error bars. Default is 1.0.
Transparency level for plots. Default is 0.4.
Step size for x-axis. Default is -1 (auto-determined).
Step size for y-axis. Default is -1 (auto-determined).
Font size for text. Default is 10.
Font size for axis labels. Default is 12.5.
Font size for legend. Default is 10.
Font size for title. Default is 10.
Flag to enable/disable LaTeX rendering. Default is true.
Dots per inch for output resolution. Default is 400.
Scaling factor for x-axis. Default is 1.25*6.4.
Scaling factor for y-axis. Default is 1.25*4.8.
Flag to enable/disable auto-scaling. Default is true.
Data for x-axis.
Data for y-axis.

Variable binning for y-axis.

detaileddescription.para: Cleans up any resources used by the plotting system.

briefdescription.para: Builds a complete path for output files based on configured settings.

simplesect.para: The constructed path as a string.

briefdescription.para: Gets the maximum value for a specified dimension.

parameterdescription.para: The dimension to find the maximum for (e.g., "x", "y", "pt").

simplesect.para: The maximum value as a float.

briefdescription.para: Gets the minimum value for a specified dimension.

parameterdescription.para: The dimension to find the minimum for (e.g., "x", "y", "pt").

simplesect.para: The minimum value as a float.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the sum of weights for normalization.

simplesect.para: The sum of weights as a float.

briefdescription.para: Builds error bars or uncertainty bands for plots.
Calculates the mean and standard deviation of a data vector.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the vector of data values.

simplesect.para: A tuple containing the mean and standard deviation.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string name, int kfold, std::vector< int > *labels, std::vector< std::vector< double >> *scores)
memberdef.name: build_ROC

briefdescription.para: Builds a Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) curve from classification results.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the ROC curve (for identification and labeling).
The k-fold cross-validation index, if applicable.
Pointer to a vector of true labels (0 or 1).
Pointer to a vector of classifier scores/probabilities.

briefdescription.para: Gets the computed ROC curve data.

simplesect.para: A vector of roc_t structures containing the ROC curve information.

briefdescription.para: Generates a 2D vector of specified dimensions and initializes it with zeros.

parameterdescription.para: The data type of the elements in the vector.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the generated 2D vector.

briefdescription.para: Provides functionality for creating and managing visualizations.

detaileddescription.para: The plotting class handles various aspects of data visualization, including creating plots, managing output formats and paths, computing statistics for plotting, and specialized physics visualization techniques like ROC curves for classifier evaluation. It inherits from both tools (for utility functions) and notification (for messaging).
